person.content:
Please identify the "Person" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: World number two Rodney Eyles moved within sight of his fifth title of the year on Friday when he hurried in only 40 minutes to the final of the richest squash tournament outside the World Open , the $ 105,000 Mahindra International .

Let's think step by step.

1. Rodney Eyles - a person who is a world number two in squash.
2. The use of "his" in the sentence also refers to a person, in this case, Rodney Eyles.

So, the "Person" entities in the paragraph are:

* Rodney Eyles
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Person.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Person".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

location.content:
Please identify the "Location" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: World number two Rodney Eyles moved within sight of his fifth title of the year on Friday when he hurried in only 40 minutes to the final of the richest squash tournament outside the World Open , the $ 105,000 Mahindra International .

Let's think step by step.

1. The first location entity in the paragraph is "the richest squash tournament outside the World Open" - this refers to a specific squash tournament which is not part of the World Open and is held at a particular location.
2. The second location entity is "the $105,000 Mahindra International" - this is the name of the tournament and provides additional information about its location, as it is likely held at a venue sponsored by Mahindra.

Therefore, the two location entities in the paragraph are "the richest squash tournament outside the World Open" and "the $105,000 Mahindra International".
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Location.

1. The richest squash tournament outside the World Open
2. the $105,000 Mahindra International

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Location".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Location |
| --- |
| The richest squash tournament outside the World Open |
| The $105,000 Mahindra International |

organization.content:
Please identify the "Organization" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: World number two Rodney Eyles moved within sight of his fifth title of the year on Friday when he hurried in only 40 minutes to the final of the richest squash tournament outside the World Open , the $ 105,000 Mahindra International .

Let's think step by step.

1. World number two Rodney Eyles is a professional squash player, but in this context, "World number two" is referring to his ranking and not a specific organization. So, we don't have an "Organization" entity in this part.
2. The "Mahindra International" is a $105,000 squash tournament. Mahindra is a multinational automobile manufacturing corporation based in India, and they are sponsoring this squash tournament. Therefore, the "Organization" entity in this paragraph is "Mahindra."
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Organization.

1. Mahindra (Organization)

Explanation:

* Mahindra is a multinational automobile manufacturing corporation based in India, and they are sponsoring the squash tournament mentioned in the paragraph. Therefore, Mahindra is the only entity that clearly refers to an Organization in this context.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Organization".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.
